entry.title: ECPAO_EE_VIEWER - delete/clear failed employee replications
entry.content:
Hi,

we have implemented the SuccessFactors integration in our S4HANA System.

At the beginning we did some tests and therefore we have in the ECPAO_EE_VIEWER a lot of failed entries with errors we don't want to solve because they are not really applicable to our business scenarios.

However, I have not find any way to delete or clear these "failed" employees replications.

Is there any way to delete/clear these failed entries so we don't see them anymore in ECPAO_EE_VIEWER until we try to process/replicate them again?

entry.title: "message": "Missing parameter: options" in SAP Document AI Upload API
entry.content:
Hi Team,

While working with the document upload api (below) in SAP document AI API from BAS 

../document-information-extraction/v1/document/jobs getting the error in network response -
{
"error": {
"code": "E95",
"message": "Required form-data not provided.",
"details": [
{
"code": "0",
"message": "Missing parameter: options"
}
]
}
}
while the same is working fine from Postman

Any help is greatly appreciated. Thank you in advance.

SAP Document AI

entry.title: CI-DS - Data visibility in IBP is not correct
entry.content:
My requirement is to load the data into the keyfigure using the master data file. so I created keyfiguredate as 20250101, 20260101 to avoid making the file too big (for example PRD1 LOC1 SourceID1 combination will have 156 lines and so on).

As my key figure disaggregation mode is 'COPY VALUE' so it should just copy across the entire horizon, which is working fine when i upload the data manually through Data integration app by selecting year in Key figure and data is disaggregated to Week level

When I use CI-DS to upload the file. in IBP, it is not showing up at technical week level. 

Is it possible somehow through CI-DS?

I am using query mapping as (to_date(to_char(FILE_EXPORT_COMP_COEFFICIENT.KEYFIGUREDATE, 'YYYYMMDD'), 'YYYYMMDD')) and transformation mapping (ifthenelse(QueryAndFilter.KEYFIGUREDATE is NULL, sysdate(), QueryAndFilter.KEYFIGUREDATE - day_in_week(QueryAndFilter.KEYFIGUREDATE) + 1), also using the global parameter in the execution properties as '$G_TIME_PROFILE_LEVEL = '2' (Time profile id - Week Technical) but can't see the data at technical week level.

entry.title: Excel Uploader-T code-KOB5
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

Please advise whether SAP has provided the functionality for the Excel uploader for T code:KOB5(Maintain Settlement Rule) as we have many hundreds of Assets wherein we will settle the Internal Order to the Fixed Assets.

I don' see any BAPI for the same as system only allows 12-13 line item postings for the settlement rule.

Please advise soon as it affects our month-end processes.

Regards,

Amit Dugar

entry.title: Stock not transferred from ROD storage location after SMQ2 error solving
entry.content:
We have a SAP S4 set-up with embedded EWM. We have a ROD (received on dock) storage location and an AFS (available for sale) storage location in our EWM. So as long as the putaway warehouse tasks aren't confirmed, the stock remains in the ROD storage location. When we then confirm the warehouse tasks, the stock is moved with a transfer order and movement type 411 automatically to storage location AFS. 

When something goes wrong on the inbound flow, and we need to reprocess an inbound delivery that got stuck in the SMQ2 error queue (note that we solve the error queue, and not just save the LUW to SMQ3!), we experience that our automatic 411 transfer from the ROD storage location to the AFS storage location does not happen anymore. Probably because the warehouse tasks that trigger it, had already been confirmed. 

Does anyone have any experience in how to solve this?

entry.title: SAP Signavio Process insights
entry.content: Can we see which processes are yet to be analysed by Signavio process insights using admin access in BTP cockpit. If not how to see the data which is yet to be analysed by the Signavio process insights system.

entry.title: -dbg.js Files Still Generated Despite Exclusion in ui5-deploy.yaml
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm running into an issue when building my UI5 application for production using a custom ui5-deploy.yaml. Despite having properly configured the exclusion of debug files (*-dbg.js and *-dbg.controller.js), they are still being generated in the dist folder.

Current ui5-deploy.yaml configuration:

Build command:

ui5 build --config=ui5-deploy.yaml --clean-dest --dest dist

 

Even with the excludes configuration, debug files like *-dbg.controller.js are still present in the build output (dist folder). This is unexpected for a production build.

Is there something I might be missing in the configuration?
Could any custom task or builder step be reintroducing the -dbg.js files?

Any help or insight would be greatly appreciated

 

Regards

entry.title: Hosting modified SAPUI5 resources
entry.content:
Hi,

We have these scenarios where we need to host OpenUI5 and/or SAPUI5 apps together with their own clones of the runtime repositories:

  1. App runs in an offline network, i.e. the clients accessing it cannot reach https://ui5.sap.com/resources from where we usually provision the runtimes.
  2. Apps can deploy online to BTP as usual, but we need to modify standard libraries. Specific example is to adjust the Fiori Elements templating process beyond what is supported in the Flexible Programming Model.

For 1.) I expect the approach would involve hosting the runtimes from https://tools.hana.ondemand.com/#sapui5 together with the app.

For 2.) I expect it would involve cloning, adjusting, building and deploying https://github.com/UI5/openui5 for OpenUI5 since it is open source, but how about SAPUI5? It would also be great to only host the particular portion of the runtime which needs adjustment (e.g. sap.fe), and convenient if the hosting could still be into the HTML5 repo and still integrate with the managed launchpad.

Has anyone tried this and have guidance, samples, best practices etc. to share?

Thanks in advance!

//Carl

entry.title: Navigation Issue in CAP UI5 Apps on BTP CF Fiori Launchpad After Page Refresh
entry.content:
Hi all,

We are building several CAP-based UI5 applications deployed on BTP Cloud Foundry.

When these applications run inside the Fiori Launchpad (FLP), we encounter a navigation issue: if a user refreshes the page explicitly, they are unable to navigate back using either the browser’s back button or the Launchpad’s NavBack button (next to the SAP home icon). Initially, the user remains stuck on the current page (the browser hash doesn’t change either). After a few clicks, they are suddenly redirected straight to the FLP home page.

There are no errors/warnings/info in the browser's console log.

This issue does not occur when the same UI5 apps are run in standalone mode (accessed via the HTML5 Applications tab in the BTP Cockpit), nor does it affect Fiori Elements apps running in FLP.

Here’s how we handle navigation and routing in our UI5 app view controllers (TypeScript):

Navigating Forward

// params are routing parameters such as mandatory parameter
public navToView(viewName: string, params?: object): void {
    this.getRouter().navTo(viewName, params ? params : {});
}

Example usage:

public onNavToNextView(): void {
    this.navToView("nextView");
}

We even added a nav back button, but it has the same problem as well.

Navigating Back

// same, params is just an obj for routing parameters
public navBackToView(viewName: string, params?: object): void {
    const history = History.getInstance();
    const previousHash = history.getPreviousHash();

    if (previousHash !== undefined) {
        window.history.go(-1);
    } else {
        this.getRouter().navTo(viewName, params ? params : {}, true);
    }
}

Example usage:

// press event for nav back button
public onNavBack(): void {
    this.navBackToView("previousView");
}

This is how we initialise the router in the Component.ts file:

this.getRouter().initialize();

This is the routing configuration in the manifest.json file:

"routing": {
      "config": {
        "routerClass": "sap.m.routing.Router",
        "controlAggregation": "pages",
        "controlId": "app",
        "transition": "slide",
        "type": "View",
        "viewType": "XML",
        "path": "myapp.view",
        "async": true,
        "bypassed": {
          "target": "notFound"
        }
      },
      "routes": [
        {
          "name": "RouteHome",
          "pattern": ":?query:",
          "target": ["TargetHome"]
        },
        {
          "pattern": "login",
          "name": "login",
          "target": "login"
        }
      ],
      "targets": {
        "TargetHome": {
          "id": "Home",
          "name": "Home",
          "level": 1
        },
        "login": {
          "viewName": "Login",
          "viewId": "login",
          "level": 1
        },
        "notFound": {
          "id": "notFound",
          "name": "NotFound",
          "transition": "show"
        }
      }
    }

 

Are we missing something in our implementation? We’ve followed UI5 examples from the Demo Kit. Could this be a known or unknown issue/bug with FLP itself?

Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you.

entry.title: Setting Default Values in Create-Dialog
entry.content:
Hi,

I'm relatively new to the topic of SAPUI5 and Fiori development.

My first litlle project is creating an app variant of  a Fiori standard app (F5241). I wanted to implement these requirements via an Fiori Adaptation Project. It should contain less fields on the Object Page and the fields "Order Type", "Planning Plant" and "Main Work Center" should have default values that are not editable for the users. Because of the fields "Order Type" and "Planning Plant" already being set in the Create-Dialog, I want to know if you have any solutions to set a default value for fields in this Create-Dialog. 

 

I would be very thankful if you can help me with that. Thank!

Best regards,

Max

entry.title: Resizing fallback dialog of sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner
entry.content:
I am developing a plugin (action) on Fiori Launchpad using sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner. My only problem is the fallback dialog.
- The size of the default input dialog is very large for my screen. The dialog looks very stretched out.
- The OK button of the dialog does not respond to Enter key press.
I tried to override the openBarcodeInputDialog but I was not able to do it.
I was able to disable the fallback option but my custom dialog function was not called. Maybe I called the function at wrong place? I am not sure.
Any leads would be highly appreciated.
Thank you!

entry.title: How to use local copy parameters html5 application on work zone advanced such as adding variant ID
entry.content:
Hello,

We have Work Zone Advanced and have built and deployed various HTML5 apps via Business Application Studio running on Cloud Foundry using OData v4. No backend content to systems such as S/4HANA, all local to BTP. 

We are creating local copies of the deployed dynamic applications to manage dynamic content for counters and titles. We are attempting to have the applications open with preselected filters but are having issues. 

  1. Cannot use operators or regular expressions for filtering fields and sorting in the parameters with the content manager local copy of the application.
    • We have attempted various ways in both the Navigation and Visualization tabs for setting filter and sorting with only success with single values and equals as the operator. For example, we cannot find a way to filter for filter = <empty>
  2. As an alternate method we attempted to follow instructions to map a variant as part of the parameters, however this was also not successful.
    • We collected the variant id from dev tools > network > changes?sap-language=en and collecting the filename such as 
      • fileName: "id_1754739886907_236_flVariant"
      • fileType: "ctrl_variant"
      • layer: "PUBLIC"
    • We followed the guides to add the parameter variable such as sap-ui-fe-variant-id and others in the link below as well as variantKey, however none of which worked. This could be due to potentially a wrong variant id however we only see one fileName captured in the Network during a variant save event as described above. 
      • https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/468a97775123488ab3345a0c48cadd8f/4132ffa02f1148058a78dfb11c8567b0.html 

 

The guidance and documentation on the usages of the navigation and visualization parameters within the work zone advance content manager UI is not clear. The general question is there clear guidance on how to setup parameters, what parameters can be used, how to open the app with a defined variant etc.?

entry.title: SAPUI5 ui.table checkbox in a column template problem
entry.content:
I am using a CheckBox in Column template in a ui.table in SAPUI5. But when scrolling the table, the CheckBox is frozen in the row, and it does not scroll. How can solve this issue?

I tried creating a Custom Checkbox without using the ui5 Checkbox but also did not work. The example that I posted is from the SDK website using the last version available.

<mvc:View
    controllerName="sap.ui.table.sample.Basic.Controller"
    xmlns="sap.ui.table"
    xmlns:mvc="sap.ui.core.mvc"
    xmlns:u="sap.ui.unified"
    xmlns:c="sap.ui.core"
    xmlns:m="sap.m"
    xmlns:p="sap.m.plugins"
    height="100%">
    <m:Page
        showHeader="false"
        enableScrolling="false"
        class="sapUiContentPadding">
        <m:content>
            <Table
                rows="{/ProductCollection}"
                selectionMode="MultiToggle"
                paste="onPaste"
                ariaLabelledBy="title">
                <extension>
                    <m:OverflowToolbar style="Clear">
                        <m:Title id="title" text="Products"/>
                    </m:OverflowToolbar>
                </extension>
                <columns>
                    <Column width="11rem">
                        <m:Label text="Product Name" />
                        <template>
                            <m:Text text="{Name}" wrapping="false" />
                        </template>
                        <dependents>
                            <p:ColumnAIAction press="onAIActionPress"></p:ColumnAIAction>
                        </dependents>
                    </Column>
                    <Column width="11rem">
                        <m:Label text="Product Id" />
                        <template>
                            <m:CheckBox/>
                        </template>
                    </Column>
                </columns>
            </Table>
        </m:content>
    </m:Page>
</mvc:View>

entry.title: System downtime message from SM02 on Fiori launchpad
entry.content:
When the system experiences downtime for a specific period, it is important to notify users promptly. In SAP GUI, system-wide announcements or maintenance notifications are broadcast using transaction code SM02. However, the Fiori Launchpad, built for a modern user experience, does not automatically display SM02 messages as popups or notifications.

To address this gap, the following blog explains how to create a custom plugin that enables downtime messages to be displayed on the Fiori Launchpad.

 

You should start by creating a new BAS project using the standard project generators for a freestyle application. To do this follow the next steps:

  1. Launch BAS. Once loaded, go to File >> New Project from Template.

 

2. Select SAP Fiori Application generator and click on Start

 

3. Select SAPUI5 freestyle from application type dropdown, followed by selecting the SAPUI5 Application generator and clicking on Next.

 

4. If you want to show hardcoded data on Popup then Select Data source = None and click on Next.

 

5. Otherwise, If you want to show message via any backend service or message present in  SM02 transaction then Select 

Data source = Connect to System

System = <Give Your system name>

Service <Select desired service url>

and click on Next.

 

 

 

6. Use default value for field View name and click on Next.

7. Enter the following details and click on Finish:

Parameter

Value

Module Name:

< Your plugin module name > (for example: zflp.systdowntime.plugin)

Application Title:

< Your plugin title > (for example: System downtime message Plugin on Launchpad)

Application Namespace:

< Your plugin namespace > (for example: com.plugin)

Description:

< Your plugin description > (for example: SAP Fiori Launchpad Plugin)

Project folder path:

< Your project root folder in BAS > (for example: /home/user/projects)

Minimum SAPUI5 version:

< Your backend system SAPUI5 library version > (for example: 1.84.14)

Add deployment Configuration:

No

Add FLP configuration

No

Configure advanced options

No

8. In our case, we need to create an SAP Fiori Launchpad plugin. Since controllers, views, and routers are not required for this plugin, we should delete the corresponding folders and their contents. To do this, right-click the folder and select Delete Permanently from the context menu.

 

9. With all files and folder deleted, your project should only contain the i18n folder, component.js and manifest.json files.

 

NOTE - As we have modified the project structure and deleted test files, you will not be able to test the plugin from BAS, you would need to deploy the plugin to the on-premise system for testing. Plugin deployment is explained in the following sections.

10. Open the manifest.json file in your project and take note of the value of the ID parameter. 

 

 

11. Do the below changes into Manifest file.

 

12. Sample Manifest code:

{

  "_version": "1.28.0",

  "sap.app": {

    "id": "com.plugin.zflp.systdowntime.plugin",

    "type": "component",

    "i18n": "i18n/i18n.properties",

    "applicationVersion": {

      "version": "0.0.1"

    },

    "title": "{{appTitle}}",

    "description": "{{appDescription}}",

    "resources": "resources.json",

    "sourceTemplate": {

      "id": "@sap/generator-fiori:basic",

      "version": "1.18.4",

      "toolsId": "d7c0a4d1-7ec4-4765-a65f-ef409eb221aa"

    },

    "dataSources": {

      "mainService": {

        "uri": "/sap/opu/odata/iwbep/Backend_Messages/",

        "type": "OData",

        "settings": {

          "annotations": [],

          "localUri": "localService/mainService/metadata.xml",

          "odataVersion": "2.0"

        }

      }

    }

  },

    "sap.flp": {

      "type": "plugin"

    },

  "sap.ui": {

    "technology": "UI5",

    "icons": {

      "icon": "",

      "favIcon": "",

      "phone": "",

      "phone@2": "",

      "tablet": "",

      "tablet@2": ""

    },

    "deviceTypes": {

      "desktop": true,

      "tablet": true,

      "phone": true

    }

  },

  "sap.ui5": {

    "flexEnabled": true,

    "dependencies": {

      "minUI5Version": "1.84.14",

      "libs": {

        "sap.m": {},

        "sap.ui.core": {}

      }

    },

    "contentDensities": {

      "compact": true,

      "cozy": true

    },

    "models": {

      "i18n": {

        "type": "sap.ui.model.resource.ResourceModel",

        "settings": {

          "bundleName": "com.plugin.zflp.systdowntime.plugin.i18n.i18n"

        }

      },

      "": {

        "dataSource": "mainService",

        "preload": true,

        "settings": {}

      }

    },

    "resources": {

      "css": [

        {

          "uri": "css/style.css"

        }

      ]

    },

    "routing": {

      "config": {

        "routerClass": "sap.m.routing.Router",

        "viewType": "XML",

        "async": true,

        "viewPath": "com.plugin.zflp.systdowntime.plugin.view",

        "controlAggregation": "pages",

        "controlId": "app",

        "clearControlAggregation": false

      },

      "routes": [

        {

          "name": "RouteView1",

          "pattern": ":?query:",

          "target": [

            "TargetView1"

          ]

        }

      ],

      "targets": {

        "TargetView1": {

          "viewType": "XML",

          "transition": "slide",

          "clearControlAggregation": false,

          "viewId": "View1",

          "viewName": "View1"

        }

      }

    },

    "rootView": {

      "viewName": "com.plugin.zflp.systdowntime.plugin.view.App",

      "type": "XML",

      "async": true,

      "id": "App"

    }

  }

}

NOTE - Plugins do not require additional definitions, this would be the simplest version of a manifest.json file and the base for creating an FLP plugin.

13.  Copy below sample code into your Component.js file code.

 

 

 

Sample Component code :

sap.ui.define([
"sap/ui/core/UIComponent",
"sap/ui/Device",
"sap/m/MessageBox"
], function (UIComponent, Device, MessageBox) {
"use strict";

return UIComponent.extend("com.plugin.zflp.sysdowntime.plugin.Component", {
metadata: {
manifest: "json"
},

/**
* The component is initialized by UI5 automatically during the startup of the app and calls the init method once.
* @Public
* @override
*/
init: function () {
// call the base component's init function
UIComponent.prototype.init.apply(this, arguments);
var that = this;
var rendererPromise = this._getRenderer();

rendererPromise.then(function (oRenderer) {
var oModel = that.getModel();
oModel.read("/downtimeMessageSets", {
success: function (oData) {
MessageBox.warning("Testing Message - System Downtime.");
console.log("Got Warning");
}
});
});
},

_getRenderer: function () {
const that = this;
const oDeferred = new jQuery.Deferred();
let oShellContainer;
that._oShellContainer = jQuery.sap.getObject("sap.ushell.Container");

if (!that._oShellContainer) {
oDeferred.reject("Illegal state: shell container not available; " +
"this component must be executed in a unified shell runtime context.");
} else {
oRenderer = that._oShellContainer.getRenderer();
if (oRenderer) {
oDeferred.resolve(oRenderer);
} else {
// renderer not initialized yet, listen to rendererCreated event
that._oShellContainer.attachRendererCreatedEvent(function (oEvent) {
oRenderer = oEvent.getParameter("renderer");
if (oRenderer) {
oDeferred.resolve(oRenderer);
} else {
oDeferred.reject("Illegal state: shell renderer not available after receiving 'rendererCreated' event.");
}
});
that._oShellContainer.attachRendererCreatedEvent(that._onRendererCreated);
}
}

return oDeferred.promise();
}
});
});

Deploy your Plugin to your SAP S/4HANA backend system.

14.  Once you have adjusted the code you would need to deploy your code to On prem system.

15.  Right-click on your project name (for example: zflp.systdowntime.plugin) and from the menu, select option Open in         Integrated Terminal.

16.  From the terminal, run command npm run deploy-config

  • Select Target : ABAP
  • Select your backend destination and press Enter.
  • Define a name for the ICF node that will be created on deployment (for example: ZFLPLUGINPOPUP) and press Enter.
  • Enter a description to your ICF node (for example: Plugin for setting FLP Title) and press Enter.
  • Enter the name of the plugin package you created earlier (for example: ZFIORI_PLUGIN) and press Enter.
  • Enter a transport request (manually, choose from existing or create a new transport request)

17.  Wait for the process to conclude.

 

18.  From the terminal, run command npm run deploy, review your deployment setting and enter YES to continue (press Enter). Wait for the process to conclude.

 

19.  Go to SICF Tcode and note down the Url .

 

20.  Now we must activate your SAP Fiori Launchpad Plugin created above. To do that login to your system in GUI or WebGUI through FLP and run transaction: /N/UI2/FLP_CONF_DEF.

21.  Accept all dialog messages, double-click on section Define Launchpad Plug-ins followed by clicking on button New Entries. Enter the following details and Save (you will be prompted for a transport request):

 

22.  Run transaction: /N/UI2/FLP_SYS_CONF

23.  Accept all dialog messages, double-click on section “Launchpad Plug-ins” section followed by clicking on button New Entries

24.  select your recently created plugin configuration (In step number 21)  and then click on Save.

25.  Once you activate your plugin it will automatically appear on your launchpad. In my case I am showing Message box. Once Launchpad is loaded our popup message will appear there.

entry.title: Error in Fetching API through SAP UI5 - CORS Error - preflightmissingalloworiginheader
entry.content:
onUpdateCaseDetails: function () {
            var sIncidentType1 = "Akash123";
            var sCaseID = "UHEALTH-INVESTIG-WORK I-61005";
            var sActionID = "pyUpdateCaseDetails";
            var sUrl = "https://leaseplan01.pegalabs.io/prweb/api/application/v2/cases/" +
                encodeURIComponent(sCaseID) +
                "/actions/" +
                encodeURIComponent(sActionID) +
                "?viewType=form";

            var sBearerToken = "XXXXXXXXX"; // your full token

            var oPayload = {
                content: {
                    IncidentType: sIncidentType1
                }
            };

            $.ajax({
                url: sUrl,
                method: "PATCH",
                contentType: "application/json",
                data: JSON.stringify(oPayload),
                headers: {
                    "Authorization": "Bearer " + sBearerToken,
                    "If-Match": "20250820T072129.183 GMT",
                    "x-origin-channel": "Web",
                    "Content-Type": "application/json",
                    "Accept": "application/json"
                    // "Access-Control-Allow-Origin" :"*"
                },
                success: function (oResponse) {
                    MessageToast.show("Case updated successfully!");
                    console.log("Update response:", oResponse);
                },
                error: function (oError) {
                    MessageToast.show("Update failed: " + oError.statusText);
                    console.error("Update error:", oError);
                }
            });
        },

entry.title: Implementing UI5 Search Field for Virtual Elements
entry.content:
Introduction

When working with Fiori Elements applications, the out-of-the-box search functionality usually triggers a backend OData filter request. This is great when all the fields you want to search on are persisted in the database.

But what happens when you need to search on a virtual/derived element (for example, a concatenated display text that doesn’t exist as a real DB field)?

In such cases, backend filtering is not possible. The request fails, or you end up with errors because the field isn’t filterable.

Recently, I faced exactly this challenge. The requirement was to allow the user to search inside a table column where the field was only derived at runtime.

Here’s how I solved it by replacing the default search with a custom search field in a UI5 Controller Extension.

Why UI5 Search Field?

  • Default FE search: Sends a filter request to the backend.

  • Problem: My search field was virtual → no DB persistence → backend rejects the filter.

  • Solution: Replace the default search with a sap.m.SearchField that applies filtering only on the client side (on already loaded table items).

Implementation Steps

1. Extend the Object Page Controller

In ObjectPageControllerExtension, override the onAfterRendering method:

onAfterRendering: function () { 
  this.addSearchFieldToTable();
  this.changeColumnLayout();
}

2. Custom Search Field

addSearchFieldToTable: function () {
    const sId = "ObjectPageSearchFieldId"; // Replace with actual ID
    const oOldSearchField = sap.ui.getCore().byId(sId);

    if (oOldSearchField) {
        // Remove default backend filter binding
        oOldSearchField.getFilter().destroy();

        // Add new SearchField with custom handler
        const oNewSearchField = new sap.m.SearchField({
            placeholder: "{i18n>searchPlaceholder}",
            search: this.onSearch.bind(this)
        });

        oOldSearchField.setFilter(oNewSearchField);
    }
}

3. Client-Side Filtering

onSearch: function (oEvent) {
    const sQuery = (oEvent.getParameter("query") || "").trim().toLowerCase();
    const oTable = sap.ui.getCore().byId("ObjectPageTableId"); // Replace with actual ID

    if (!oTable) return;

    // Reset visibility
    oTable.getItems().forEach(oItem => oItem.setVisible(true));

    // Empty query → show all
    if (!sQuery || sQuery === "*") return;

    // Filter items by virtual field
    oTable.getItems().forEach(oItem => {
        const oData = oItem.getBindingContext()?.getObject();
        const sVirtualText = oData?.VirtualConcatenatedText || "";
        const aParts = sVirtualText.split(",").map(a => a.trim().toLowerCase());

        const bMatch = aParts.some(a => a.includes(sQuery));
        oItem.setVisible(bMatch);
    });
}

Result

Users can now search by the virtual text field even though it’s not persisted in the database.

  • Filtering happens instantly on the UI without backend calls.

  • Backend remains clean since no invalid OData requests are sent.

Key Takeaways

  • Use client-side filtering when your search target is a virtual/derived element.

  • This pattern can be reused in scenarios where backend filtering isn’t possible (e.g., calculated fields, concatenated strings, or UI-only attributes).

entry.title: About: Configuring the Output of Balance Confirmations
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

As part of a S4 HANA transformation (S4HANA on premise - 02 (10/2024) fps), it is planned to generate balance confirmations in the future using the Fiori apps Schedule Accounts Receivable (F2366) and Schedule Accounts Payable Jobs (F2257).

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/918bca53037f408f91a2295d04ac16bc/0830c3f55dd348b0bf522b4dc3795197.html?locale=de-DE

The application object type FIN_FO_BLNC_CNFRM for balance confirmation is already set to active.
In the Output Parameters (OPD) app, various application object types are displayed for defining the rules, but I am unable to select balance confirmation.

What else needs to be done to complete the configuration?

Thank you in advance

Kind regards

Jonas

entry.title: Fallback method for opening web applications in iframe if loading fails
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am trying to implement a fallback mechanism for opening a web application inside an iframe. If the app fails to load in the iframe, I want to automatically open it in a new browser tab.

Here’s are the implementations that I have tried so far, I am providing a brute code of the methods that I have tried implementing:

onTilePress: function (oEvent) {
    var sUrl = oEvent.getSource().getBindingContext("appModel").getProperty("url");
    var oFrame = this.byId("appFrame");

    // attachAfterRendering for iframe handling
    oFrame.attachAfterRendering({ url: sUrl }, function (oEvent, oData) {
        var iframe = document.querySelector("iframe");

        if (!iframe) {
            console.error("Iframe not found");
            return;
        }

        // Listen for load success/failure
        iframe.onload = function () {
            console.log("App loaded successfully in iframe");
        };

        iframe.onerror = function () {
            console.error("Error loading app in iframe, opening in new tab");
            window.open(oData.url, "_blank");
        };

        // Safety fallback - message event listener
        window.addEventListener("message", function (e) {
            console.log("Message received from origin:", e.origin);
            // Expected origin is from embedded app, but I only get the portal origin here
        });

        // Detach afterrendering after execution
        oFrame.detachAfterRendering();
    });
}

 

Challenges I am facing:

  1. iframe.onload and iframe.onerror are never triggered – not even for successful apps.

  2. onAfterRendering only detects the UI5 HTML control render, not the internal iframe load state.

  3. When listening for postMessage, I get the custom portal origin (e.g., https://port8081-workspaces...) instead of the embedded app’s origin, so I cannot distinguish failures correctly.


    Can someone please help me to find a correct way to detect if an app inside an iframe has failed to load in SAP UI5 (so that I can implement a proper fallback to open it in a new tab)?
    Also suggest if is there a recommended UI5 mechanism to achieve this?

    Thanks in advance,
    Sai Krishna.

entry.title: SAP Fiori not calling Odata. RAP Preview working fine
entry.content:
Hi,

In my current project, I’m developing a SAP Fiori app using Visual Studio Code. However, the main challenge is that VS Code isn’t connected to the SAP backend. To work around this, I’m downloading an existing app using the standard program /UI5/UI5_REPOSITORY_LOAD, making the necessary changes locally, and then uploading it back to the SAP backend using the same program. This process creates a BSP application.

The backend OData service has been generated using RAP. When I preview the service binding in Eclipse, everything works perfectly—the OData call is successful, and the view is rendered correctly. 

The Network tab in the Edge browser’s Developer Tools confirms this, as shown in the screenshot. No issues so far.

To replicate this behavior in my standalone Fiori app, I checked the source in the app preview to identify the URI being called.

I then used this exact URI in the manifest.json file of my app in VS Code. The screenshot below shows the manifest.json from my standalone VS Code project.

However, when I test the app using SE80 (by right-clicking and selecting Test in SAPGUI after uploading), the OData service isn’t being called, and the view isn’t generated. The screen remains blank. The Network tab in Edge shows no OData activity, and although the Console logs some generic errors, they also appear in other working apps.

I’ve checked all the usual places for errors—/IWFND/ERROR_LOG, ST22, SLG1, and SU53—but found nothing relevant.

Network in Developer tool of the Edge browser doesn't show any Odata call.

Console shows some error, but these are generic error which I can see in other apps as well which are working just fine.

I’m stuck at this point and would really appreciate any guidance on what might be going wrong or what else I can check.

Thanks,
